alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 02 at 10:31AM PST until January 03 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: .A series of fronts is likely to bring periods of moderate to heavy precipitation totaling 2 to 6 inches of water over much of southwestern Oregon and far northwestern California tonight, January 2nd, into Wednesday, January 5th. Snow levels will generally rise during this time period leading to melting of the lower elevation snowpack across the area. This will lead to rapid rises on area streams, creeks, and rivers, as well as possible flooding during this time period. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Rapid water level rises and possible localized flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snow melt is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern California and southwest Oregon, including the following areas, in northern California, western Siskiyou County. In southwestern Oregon, western and central Douglas County, Coos County, Curry County, and much of Josephine County. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff will result in rapid rises and possible localized flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Extensive low elevation snow pack with heavy rain on it over the next 2 to 3 days will lead to the possibility of localized flooding of streams, creeks, and low lying areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast
